column3: Title
column9: Controlling Information Including Spreading Misinformation and Propaganda
column10: Control of Science & Health to Align with State Ideology

column3: No high-level US representative to attend UN's COP30 climate talks. The US has always sent delegations of various sizes to UN climate summits over the past three decades, even during periods under George W Bush and in Donald Trump’s first term. This decision underscores administration’s hostility to climate action

Access to gender-affirming care for transgender youth will be dramatically restricted by the Trump administration under new proposals by the Department of Health and Human Services. Both supporters and opponents of transgender rights agree that, if implemented, the proposals could make access to pediatric gender-affirming care across the country extremely difficult, if not impossible

Most of the government editorial staff at "Preventing Chronic Disease", an academic journal published by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) for more than 2 decades, have been told they’re being terminated, leaving the publication’s future uncertain.

The senior head of a Navy office that helps organize critical research and funding for the service has been replaced by a 33-year-old former Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) employee . His replacement is highly unusual given that the office — created by Congress in 1946 to fund Navy and Marine Corps research — is typically run by a two-star admiral with extensive experience in technology, science, and engineering.

Radio Free Asia, one of four federally funded news organizations the Trump administration has aimed to close, will shut down its news operations at the end of October. The news group’s expected closure can be attributed to the Trump administration’s broad efforts to cut federal funding, and to the government shutdown

Donald Trump has fired all six members of an independent federal agency responsible for reviewing his controversial White House ballroom and planned “Arc de Trump” in Washington DC. The White House says it will appoint new Commission of Fine Arts members ‘more aligned with … America First Policies’
Health Secretary RFK Jr asks Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) to study alleged harms of offshore wind farms

Texas Attorney Tim Paxton sues Tylenol makers, accusing them of knowingly hiding the drug's links to autism and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder. There is no good evidence that tylenol (paracetamol) is linked to autism or ADHD

Threat to US vaccines as entire staff supporting Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices (ACIP) were let go as well as its Ethics and CDC's Human Resources department. This is according to former Chief Medical Officer Debra Houry and Demetre Daskalakis, former director of the National Center for Immunization and Respiratory Diseases who spoke at. a press conference

Trump on social media gives new warning on pregnant women taking Tylenol (Paracetamol), or giving Tylenol to their children. He also said parents should split vaccination visits for many childhood vaccines. There is no evidence for harm for Tylenol or combine vaccines. More visits will reduce uptake, and for some diseases the combined vaccines are more effective than single shots.
Health secretary RFK Jr (Kennedy) to urge American to eat more saturated fats, contradicting decades of dietary guidelines
Trump reverses Biden-era rule on copper smelters - the rule had imposed stricter limits on emissions.

Trump administration announced a plan to allow oil and gas drilling in Alaska’s Arctic National Wildlife Refuge, one of the largest remaining tracts of pristine wilderness in the United States. In addition the Interior Department said it would hold an oil and gas lease sale in the coastal plain as soon as this winter.

The University of Virginia has reached a deal with adminstration to end investigations against it and restore funding. It agreed to be bound by federal guidance forbidding racial discrimination in admission and hiring, as described by the Justice Department. It also agreed to provide relevant data on a quarterly basis through 2028. The president will have to personally certify that the university is in compliance each quarter
Trump demolishes the entire historic White House East Wing to make room for new ballroom. Trump initially said the construction would not touch the East Wing or “interfere with the current building.”
US demands EU reverse its climate and human rights rules in order to allow greater imports of liquefied natural gas (LNG)

More than 420 anti-science bills attacking longstanding public health protections – vaccines, milk safety and fluoride – have been introduced in statehouses across the U.S. this year, part of an organized, politically savvy campaign to enshrine a conspiracy theory-driven agenda into law. the wave of legislation has cropped up in most states, pushed by people with close ties to Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.

The US Senate is poised to approve Donald Trump’s nomination of an industry lobbyist to lead the Environmental Protection Agency’s (EPA) chemical safety office. If confirmed, the top four toxics office positions at the EPA will be held by former chemical industry lobbyists, raising new fears about the health and safety of the American public
US blocks a global fee on shipping emissions as international meeting ends without new regulations

National Snow and Ice Data Center (NSIDC) announced suspension or reduction of several tools, services and report due to its funding not being renewed by the Administration. These data are important for tracking climate change.

A quarter of the CDC workforce has been fired or has resigned since January 2025. Another round of terminations, combined with previous layoffs and departures, has reduced the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention workforce by about 3,000 people since January.

Trump expands preferential funding offer to all US colleges. The Compact agreement would grant preferential funding in return for a slew of commitments including DEI bans and a 15% cap on colleges’ international undergraduate students. [This was initially sent to 9 unis, MIT rejected it]

Although almost half of the 1300 CDC lay-offs have been rescinded, around 600 remain fired. This include around 100 who were working at the National Center for Health Statistics and a team that is part of the day-to-day operations for the National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey

Dept of Education (DoE) lays off majority of special education staff including in the Office of Special Education and Rehabilitative Services, which oversees programs that support millions of children and adults with disabilities nationwide
RFK Jr during a cabinet meeting acknowledged that here is no proof to his alleged links with Tylenol and autism, but then proceeded to say "we're doing the studies to make the proof'

Trump administration lays off CDC staff, including high-ranking scientists, the entire Washington office, 70 Epidemic Intelligence Service staff and the entire staff of the weekly publication Morbidity and Mortality Weekly Report. It reinstated many of them 2 days later
The Trump administration has killed a massive proposed solar power project in Nevada that would have been one of the largest in the world
RFK Jr links autism to circumcised boys being given tylenol after circumcision. Scientists say "studies have found no credible evidence linking Tylenol or circumcision to autism."

Jim O'Neill, deputy secretary of the Dept of Health and Human Services (HHS) and acting director of the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) called for new monovalent vaccines to replace the combined MMR vaccine.
US demands EU dismantle green regulations in threat to trade deal
Trump administration considers cutting billions in funds from list of clean energy projects, including awards for auto manufacturing and carbon capture

Trump orders approval of 211-mile mining road through Alaska wilderness to allow mining of copper, cobalt, gold and other minerals. - this was previously blocked by the Biden administration and would harm wildlife and indigenous tribes

CDC removes support for COVID-19 booster, backing RFK Jr's hand-picked advisory panel (ACIP), saying they should be administered through shared decision-making with a healthcare provider. In addition the recommendations AGAINST the use of the combined measles-mumps-rubella-varicella (MMRV) vaccine before the age of 4 years were also signed off.
Health Secretary RFK Jr fires top NIH scientist weeks after she filed a whistleblower complaint about the administrations' hostility towards vaccines

The White House issued a press release with links to scientific studies to back up Trump’s claim that use of Tylenol during pregnancy causes autism, but experts say those studies do not support the claim

CDC still hasn't issued covid vaccine guidance following the vaccine committee meeting. This is highly unusual as normally CDC guidance is updated within hours of the meeting, and leaves people in limbo unable to get their booster shots

The White House sent letters to nine of the nation’s top public and private universities, urging campus leaders to pledge support for President Trump’s political agenda to help ensure access to federal research funds

President Donald Trump's administration is cancelling nearly $8 billion in climate-related funding targeting 16 U.S. states, including California and New York, White House budget director Russ Vought said, following through on threats to use the shutdown to punish Democrat states

The White House abruptly fired a large share of the council members advising the National Endowment for the Humanities, retaining only four appointees of President Donald Trump. A White House spokesperson told The Post in an email that the president is “hoping to place members on the board who align more closely with his vision.”
Dept of Justice launches investigation into Des Moines (Iowa) public schools system over race-based hiring practices and DEI policies. Last week its superintendent was arrested
President Donald Trump said that his administration had reached a deal with Harvard University after months of negotiations and that the Ivy League school will pay $500 million.
The White House is canceling millions of dollars that dozens of universities use to research food production, despite budget chief Russ Vought’s promise to leave that money untouched.

Dept of Energy tells staff at the Office of Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy to stop using terms including “climate change”, “decarbonization”, “sustainable”, “emissions” and “green”. Also on the list are “energy transition”, “‘clean’ or ‘dirty’ energy” and “carbon/CO2 ‘Footprint’”.

Schools, food banks and other organizations are rushing to wind down nutrition and health programming once funded by the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program Education, known as SNAP-Ed. The program was eliminated by Trump's spending bill, effective September 30.
California State University System (CSU) faces antisemitism complaint filed by the Trump administration
Dept of Health and Human Services refers Harvard for administrative suspension and debarment proceedings, seeking federal funding ineligibility
Trump administration to expand coal mine leasing on 13.1 million acres of federal land to support more coal powered energy generation

US refuses to back UN declaration on noncommunicable diseases. General assembly backs new targets on cancer, diabetes and heart disease but Robert F Kennedy Jr objects, citing abortion and 'gender ideology' despite these not being in the declaration

the U.S. National Science Foundation (NSF) which funds a prestigious Graduate Research Fellowship Program has stopped 2nd year PhD students being eligible. and narrowed the application timeline. Awarded fellowshops will align with administration priorities.
Acadia National Park removes educational signs about climate change, Indigenous history
US health secretary Kennedy considers adding autism symptoms to vaccine injury program
Trump energy secretary Chris Right to return billions set aside for green projects, stating climate accords have not lowered emissions
Trump suggests changes to childhood vaccine schedule should be "based on what I feel"

Trump administration ignores science and links autism to painkiller acetaminophen (Tylenol, paracetamol), urging pregnanat people not to use it. Trump also promotes many other false claims about vaccines

Scientists at the Environmental Protection Agency’s Office of Water, which ensures drinking water is safe, have been instructed by Trump officials to halt publishing ongoing research in an “unprecedented” move

The Trump administration ends government’s annual report on hunger in America, stating that it had become “overly politicized” and “rife with inaccuracies.”. The decision comes two and a half months after Trump signed legislation sharply reducing food aid to the poor.
Oklahoma proposing a law that requires every higher education institution in the state to create a Charlie Kirk Memorial Plaza with statue

President Donald Trump's administration escalated its campaign against Harvard University by placing new restrictions on the Ivy League school's ability to access federal funds for student aid, citing concerns about the "financial position" of the oldest and richest university in the United States.

A panel of U.S. vaccine advisers named by Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. on Friday abandoned years of broad support for the COVID-19 shot and recommended that the vaccines be made available for all ages based on shared clinical decision-making with a physician

The Trump administration is changing how and where the U.S. government delivers health aid around the world, breaking decades of practice to bypass nongovernmental organizations and prioritize the Western Hemisphere and Asia Pacific regions over Africa
Dept of Education (DoE) to prioritse "patriotic education" in discretionary grants

U.S. government lawyers attempted to block a vaccine skeptic appointed by Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy, Jr. from assuming new powers at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention that could be used to restrict access to COVID-19 shots. Their advice was overridden.

US Interior Dept states all interpretive signage in National Parks are under review and the Washington Post reported that it has ordered the removal of signs and exhibits related to slavery at multiple national parks, including a historic photograph of a formerly enslaved man showing scars on his back.

Cuts at the Centers for Disease Control (CDC) forced Mississippi data collection for Pregnancy Risk Assessment Monitoring System (Prams), a national database that has been integral to policymaking on maternal and infant health for nearly four decades. Mississippi has just declared an infant deaths emergency.
Dept of Health and Human Services (HHS) names 5 new ACIP members, of which at least three are COVID-19 vaccine critics
University of California Berkeley shares 160 academic names with Trump administration in ‘McCarthy era’ move
Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) to stop collecting emissions data from polluters, incl coal-burning power plants, oil refineries, steel mills and other industrial facilities across the country.
Trump officials to link COVID vaccination with rare child deaths
Court allows Trump administration to end Planned Parenthood's Medicaid funding

Dept of Education (DoE) revokes Minority-Serving Institution (MSI) funding for colleges with large minority student populations, claiming funding violated the law because it goes to institutions that “meet racial or ethnic quotas.”
Judge allows Trump to cut more than $1 billion in National Science Foundation (NSF) grants

US treasury-led watchdog, The Financial Stability Oversight Council, disbands two climate advisory panels: the Climate-Related Financial Risk Committee and the Climate-Related Financial Risk Advisory Committee
Bureau of Land Management proposes to scrap Biden-era rule protecting public lands. This would prioritise public land for oil and gas drilling, mining and other industrial activities
Leaked docs show that worker at Hyundai plant who was detained in ICE raid had valid visa, but officials "mandated' that he agree to be removed and deported to South Korea

Texas A&M University children's literature professor, dean of the college for art and science and the head of department were fired over gender content and pressure from Republican politicians including Gov Abbott
Dept of Health and Human Services has put on ice a CDC project that would make information about dozens of infectious diseases available in near real time in a user friendly way to the public
Top health officials under U.S. Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. are compiling examples of harmful effects from COVID-19 vaccines on pregnant women to share with the public
Trump shares video linking autism to vaccines on his Truth Social Media

Federal report on alcohol drinking withdrawn and to be replaced with US dietary guidelines, based on a competing report favoured by the alcohol industry, stating that moderate alcohol consumption is healthier than not drinking

RFK Jr hints that access to abortion drug mifepristone could be rolled back, claiming the Biden adminstration "twisted" the data. This is despite evidence from over 100 studies that it is safe and effective.

Ousted CDC director Susan Monarez states that she was fired after refusing to comply with RFK Jrs "troubling directives", including to preapprove the recommendations of a “vaccine advisory panel newly filled with people who have publicly expressed antivaccine rhetoric.”
Department of Justice considering to ban trans people from buying guns - this follows a shooting at a school in Minnesota
New NIH funding rules shift decision-making power from peer review panels to political appointees in determining future scientific grants.
Vinay Prasad, the Food and Drug Administration's (FDA) top vaccine official overuled scientists on wider access to COVID-19 shots
Trump targets another off-shore wind project for cancellation (New England 1 and 2)
FDA questions safety of receiving COVID-19 and flu shot together despite no evidence of harm
Paul Offit, an outspoken critic of Trump and his administration is dismissed from FDA vaccine panel

Dept of Energy's (DoE) contentious climate report (complied by five hand-picked fringe researchers) criticised by 85 top climate scientsts as biased, riddled with errors and failing basic scientific credibility.
Previous CDC directors write a public article in the New York Times warning that Kennedy (JFK Jr) is endangering the health of Americans

Donald Trump on Monday called on pharmaceutical companies to justify the success of their drugs intended to treat COVID. Trump said there is disagreement on whether the drugs saved lives but the scientific consensus and evidence is clear that they have saved millions of lives.
Possible changes to the National Vaccine Injury Compensation Program (VICP) by RFK Jr might threaten vaccine availability
FDA's top vaccine regulator Vinay Prasad requests removal of youtube videos of him criticising COVID-19 vaccines

Demetre Daskalakis, recently resigned director of the National Center for Immunization and Respiratory Diseases in the Centers for Disease Control (CDC), said" No one from my center has ever briefed [Kennedy (RFK)] on any of those topics … He’s getting information from somewhere, but that information is not coming from CDC expert"

Trump cancelling $679 billion in federal funding on off-shore wind projects - U.S. Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy announced that the department was cancelling or terminating awards made under the Biden administration.

The White House replaces fired CDC chief Monarez with O'Neill, a former investment executive with no medical or scientific background. He is currently RFK Jr's (Kennedy) deputy at Health at Human Services

RFK Jr. (Kennedy) Blames Gun Violence on Antidepressants After Minneapolis School Shooting: 'We're Launching Studies'. Robert F. Kennedy Jr. claimed SSRI (anti-depressant) medications carry warnings of homicidal thoughts, which mental health experts say is not true
New Trump rule to ban doctors from the US Dept of Veteran Affairs (VA) to perform abortions, even in case of incest or rape

The Pediatric Brain Tumor Consortium, an association of 16 academic centers and children’s hospitals dedicated to trials of novel treatments for pediatric brain cancer, is halting enrollment in clinical trials for children with brain cancer after the federal government said it would no longer provide funding to the group.
The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has scaled back a federal-state surveillance program for foodborne pathogens.

RFK Jr (Kennedy) and White House say that Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) have to align with MAHA agenda and accept recommendations from new vaccine panel members, handpicked by Kennedy (ACIP)

Dept of Education (DoE) threatens to pull federal funding from Denver schools for violating students’ civil rights by providing gender-neutral bathroom facilities and letting transgender students use bathrooms that align with their gender identity. Schools have 10 days to comply

White House fires new Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) director Susan Monarez, after she refused to resign ; three senior CDC offiials resigned immediately after over "weaponizing of public health"

US Dept of Justice (DoJ) opens investigation into California's Environmental Protection Agency, aiming to determine if it "may be engaged in employment practices that discriminate based on race, sex, color, or national origin,"
Trump administration moves to tighten duration of visas for students and media
University of Michigan Hospital ends gender-affirming care for minors, citing federal pressure. The decision comes after the University received a subpoena from the Department of Justice
Trump says he wants ‘nothing less than $500m’ from Harvard as a condition for restoring billions of dollars in federal funding

The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) suspended around 30 employees after those workers wrote to Congress warning that the Trump administration had gutted the nation’s ability to handle hurricanes, floods and other extreme weather disasters.
Federal agencies including departments of defense (DoD) and energy and commerce to work together to review offshore wind farms approved by the Biden administration, according to RFK Jr.

Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) asks 46 states/territories to remove all references to "gender ideology" from federally funded sex ed program. States aree given 60 days to revise materials

US CDC taps vaccine skeptic, Retsef Levi, to lead its COVID vaccine workgroup. Retsef Levi had critiqued mRNA vaccines in the past, saying they can cause serious harm and death, especially among children, and called for their immediate withdrawal.
Trump administration pushes ahead with National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) and weather cuts, despite congressional resistance
President Donald Trump and Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. (RFK) are allegedly planning to ban the COVID vaccine "within months," according to an associate of Kennedy's.
Kennedy Center's new director of Dance critisises ballet culture as "woke" and complained about "radically leftist ideologies in ballet"

The Trump administration (Dept of Justice, DOJ) said it will not defend a decades-old grant program for colleges with large numbers of Hispanic students that is being challenged in court, declaring the government believes the funding is unconstitutional.
Trump rolls back rules meant to keep politics out of climate research

Trump administration's Bureau of Ocean Management (BOEM) halts off-shore wind project in Rhode Island. The Revolution Wind Project, a $1.5 billion plan, approved under former President Biden is 80 percent complete and projected to be finished by 2026, according to Ørsted. The company says it’s “fully permitted, having secured all required federal and state permits.”

Kennedy Center fires dance director and two other dance programmers saying he had lost confidence in “the ability of the department as currently constituted to align with the priorities of the Kennedy Center.”
White House Advisor Lindsey Halligan defending the administration's move to "review" Smithonian content stating an overemphasis on slavery

Trump administration rescinding federal guidance requiring schools to provide a broad range of services to students who are not proficient in English. These had been in place since 2015, and this will likely weaken support for immigrant children

Trump administration cuts California grant for program designed to prevent teenage pregnancy and childhood sexually transmitted infections, saying the state refused to remove "radical gender ideology" from its curriculum.
Supreme Court (SCOTUS) allows Trump administration to cut $783m in NIH funds in its push to cut federal diversity, equity and inclusion efforts

A coal-fired plant in Michigan was to close. But Trump forced it to keep running at $1m a day. The town had big plans for the facility site, until the Trump administration ordered it to stay open, a move it extended this week

RFK Jr attacks American Academy of Pediatrics over their vaccine recommendations, accusing the group of being part of a pay-to-play scheme to promote commercial ambitions of AAP’s big pharma benefactors
US Dept of Agriculture (USDA) limits funding for wind and solar energy on farmland
Trump attacks American museums for being 'too woke' and talking too much about slavery
US State Department revokes 6,000 student visas

Oklahoma to vet prospective teachers from New York And California with "America First" test. Teachers from California and New York to be grilled on such topics as ‘biological differences between males and females’

A new wave of book bans has hit Florida school districts, with hundreds of titles being pulled from library and classroom shelves as the school year kicks off. The books taken off the school shelves included The Diary of Anne Frank and What Girls Are Made of.
Internal Revenue Service (IRS) issues new rules that restrict wind and solar projects to claim federal tax breaks

The Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) said it is reviving a long-defunct task force on the safety of childhood vaccines, responding to a demand from the anti-vaccine organization founded by HHS Secretary Robert F. Kennedy (RFK) Jr
Acting NASA administratorSean Duffy says climate science will "move aside" and all focus at NASA will be on space exploration
Trump casts himself for Kennedy Center Honors - handpicking honorees and excluding those who are 'too woke'

NASA is planning to decommission premier (and fully functioning) satellite missions that gather information on planet-warming pollution and other climate vital signs as soon as October, marking the latest step by the Trump administration to scale back federal climate science.
Federal Trade Commission (FTC) invalidates California emissions reduction agreement with truck manufacturers
Dept of Health and Human Services (HHS) orders Vaxart's mRNA COVID-19 vaccine trials to stop mid-trial as part of mRNA vaccine wind down
US Dept of Agriculture (USDA) moves to end union contracts for 6500 Food Safety Inspection Services (FSIS) and 150 Animal and Plant Health Inspection Services (APHIS)

White House announces comprehensive review of Smithsonian Museum exhibitions “to assess tone, historical framing and alignment with American ideals", and “replacing divisive or ideologically driven language with unifying, historically accurate and constructive descriptions.”
US to retaliate against International Maritime Organization (IMO) member countries that back IMO's net zero emissions plan for international shipping
Kennedy (RFK) Jr. contradicts law enforcement on CDC shooter motive claiming not enough was known about the motive (this is untrue)
Department of Justice (DOJ) says that George Washington University (GWU) violated federal civil rights laws by failing to take "meaningful action" against anti-semitism
National Institute of Health (NIH) Director, Bhattacharya , spreads vaccine Misinformation about Covid mRNA vaccines One Day After CDC Shooting [controlling information; attacking science/health]
Trump signs executive order to tighten federal grant approvals, with grant award decisions to now undergo evaluation by Trump's political appointees

Trump administration threatens to take Harvard's patents in new escalation - "Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick is launching an "immediate comprehensive review" of whether Harvard has complied with federal laws around patents"
Trump administration seeking $1 billion settlement from UCLA

The Smithsonian National Museum of American History changes descriptions of Trump's role on Jan 6. it removed some details of the charges President Trump faced when it replaced a display about his two impeachments.

Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) database helping companies calculate greenhouse emissions at risk of no longer being updated after its creator was suspended for criticising the Trump administration
US to rewrite its past national climate reports, furthering its efforts to undermine the scientific consensus on human-caused global warming.

US government plans to incinerate $9.7 mio in already purchased birth control pills and conttraceptives after USAID shut down, despite other orgnaisations offering to distribute them at no cost to the US
UCLA says the Trump administration froze $584mio of its federal funding
Trump to sign EO requiring all universities to disclose admissions data on race to prove that they are not engaged in "affirmative action"
Energy Sectretary suggests that the administration are updating previously published National Climate Assessments, saying previus reports "weren’t fair in broad-based assessments of climate change.”
RFK Jr's. (Kennedy) Health department to halt $500m in mRNA vaccine research, questioning its safety.
EPA moves to cancel $7billion in grants for solar energy (intended to help low and moderate income families install solar panels)

The Trump administration has asked NASA employees to draw up plans to end at least two major satellite missions designed and built specifically to monitor planet-warming greenhouse gases. The data they collect is widely used, including by scientists and farmers

Secretary of Health RFK Jr (Kennedy) publishes a non-peer reviewed article alleging harm from aluminium salts in vaccine products that is not based on scientific evidence, and could be a prelude to banning vaccines (including many routine childhood vaccines) that continain aluminium salts
Trump freezes $200 million in UCLA science and medical research funding, citing antisemitism
Trump administration blocks funding for CDC programs including youth violence prevention programs, gun injury and death and programs tackling diabetes and tobacco use

American Medical Association (AMA), American Academy of Pediatrics and Infectious Disease Society of America are kicked out of ACIP (Advisory Comittee on Immunization Practices) workgroups at CDC (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention)

A researcher on a green card at Texas A&M University flying home from abroad was detained for more than a week by immigration authorities at the San Francisco International Airport, sleeping in a chair and living off food sold in the airport. Kim, who went to South Korea to attend his brother’s wedding, is now in removal proceedings to be deported. Neither he nor his lawyers know why.
Trump administration's Bureau of Ocean Energy Management cancels off-shore wind projects
Trump administration has sent letter to Harvard referring it to the Department of Justice in civil rights probe to address allegations of Harvard"s antisemitic discrimination
Former vaccine panel ousted by RFK (Kennedy) Jr. says scientific rigor is "rapidly eroding"
Environment Protection Agency (EPA) moves ahead with plans to undo almost all UC climate regulations by rescinding the "endangerment finding"
Energy Department attacks climate science in new contentious report criticising the consensus on global wamring

Brown University reaches deal with Trump administration to restore $50m in funds and will commit to nondiscrimination in admissions and campus programs, and grant officials access to its admissions data. Brown says the government does not have the authority to dictate teaching, learning and academic speech
Army Secretary withdraws a publicised West Point distinguished professorship appointment from former Biden official amid pressure from right wing activist Laura Loomer
A new Department of Energy (DoE) report “fundamentally misrepresents” climate research and leaves out key context, say multiple scientists cited in the report

The Trump administration has frozen $108m in federal National Institute of Health (NIH) research funding to Duke University after the federal government announced that it was investigating allegations that the school engaged in racial discrimination in the form of affirmative action,
Harvard to comply with Trump official's demands to turn over employment forms
Department of the Interior scraps preferential treatment for wind energy
Department of Education (DOE) and Dept of Health and Human Services (HHS) investigating Duke University and the Duke Law Journal over race-related discrimination allegations.

The National Science Foundation (NSF) plans to abruptly end operation of the last remaining US research ship capable of braving the farthest reaches of Antarctica and the Southern Ocean. It supports crucial climate change research

RFK Jr. targets vaccine injury compensation program (VICP) saying "I will not allow the VICP to continue to ignore its mandate and fail its mission of quickly and fairly compensating vaccine-injured individuals,"
Harvard contemplating spending up to $500 Million to placate Trump White House
With Columbia as a model, White House seeks fines in potential deals with Harvard and others
NASA says about 20% of staff to leave the agency
Donald Trump calls illegal migration a "horrible invasion" that is "killing Europe" and also attacks European wind farms on a trip to Scotland
RFK Jr. (Kennedy) to Oust Advisory Panel on Cancer Screenings, HIV Prevention Drugs. The panel determines which preventive services insurers must cover at no cost to patients
Outcry as US agriculture department to cut salaries and relocate staff. Experts warn ‘half-baked’ restructuring will further erode support for US farmers and hamper wildfire response

Department of Education (DOE) says five school districts in Democratic-leaning Northern Virginia were violating federal law by allowing transgender students to use bathrooms and other facilities matching their gender identity.

Consent decrees meant to curb police abuse are ending in more than 20 cities, including Breonna Taylor’s Louisville, after Department of Justice (DoJ) announced a reversal in investigations and consent decrees in May
Trump administration, in an emergency appeal, asks Supreme Court to allow NIH (National Institutes of Health) to cut funding for grants related to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DEI)

The White House is seeking fines from several universities it says failed to stop antisemitism on campus, including hundreds of millions of dollars from Harvard University, in exchange for allowing the schools to access federal funding
Senate confirms Trump's EPA air office nominee Aaron Szabo, a former lobbyist who has links to the oil industry and is a co-author in a chaper of Project 25 on dismantling the EPA
Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) seeks to bring back twice-already banned pesticide
Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) rescinds $20m for clean water in pesticide-riden rural California claiming it is a "wasteful DEI program"

Columbia University will pay $200m to the federal government over accusations it failed to protect its Jewish students and “not maintain programs that promote unlawful efforts” related to diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI). Settlement allows federal govt oversight into its admissions. In return govt will restart some grants to Columbia

Artist, famous for her portrait of Michelle Obama, cancels show at Smithsonian citing censorship, after learning that her painting of a transgender Statue Of Liberty might be removed to avoid provoking Trump

US AI action plan "continues this crusade against “woke” AI, recommending that federal procurement guidelines are updated so that only AI companies that “ensure that their systems are objective and free from top-down ideological bias” are given contracts."

The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has drafted a proposal to reverse a landmark scientific finding that climate change pollution from fossil fuels endangers human health ('the endangerment finding'), which would reduce EPA's ability to limit greenhouse gas producing industry
State Department Opens New Investigation Into Harvard’s Use of International Visas
RFK Jr to remove preservative thimerosal from all US vaccines . Anti-vaccine campaigns have targeted thimerosal for decades despite no evidence of ingredient causing harm

Congress voted to restore $400 million for the federal program to combat HIV in developing nations (PEPFAR) but that may be short-lived: Officials at the State Department have been mapping out a plan to shut it down anyway

The Harvard Educational Review academic journal abruptly cancels entire special issue on Education and Palestine shortly before release, "a remarkable new development in a mounting list of examples of censorship of pro-Palestinian speech"
Trump attacks federal judge presiding over Harvard case and also attacks Harvard as “anti-Semitic, anti-Christian, and anti-America,”
Trump administration to destroy nearly $10m in contraceptives that were intended for women in Africa

Plan for "infertility training centre" as birth control program signals new approach to helping women get pregnant taking funds from program that provided low-income women with birth control (Title X)
Head of the Bureau of Consular Affairs says that criticism of Israel can lead to visa revocations

Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) says it will dismantle its scientific research arm. The EPA's science office has provided the independent research that underpins nearly all of the agency’s policies and regulations. It has analyzed the risks of hazardous chemicals, the impact of wildfire smoke on public health and the contamination of drinking water by hydraulic fracturing, or fracking

Conservative legal group America First Legal ( founded and run by Trump advisor Stephen Miller) has filed a complaint to Dept of Justice (DoJ) against Johns Hopkins Universiy School of Medicine, alleging racial discrimination
A new study reveals that many government health datasets have been changed without public notice, raising concerns about scientific integrity and the impact on research
FDA chief medical and scientific officer Prasad again overrides FDA vaccine reviewers on Moderna COVID-19 vaccination for children
US nuclear regulator (USNRC) asks job seekers political questions

Hundreds of National Weather Service (NWS) and National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) staff who are responsible for weather forecasts, severe weather alerts, and providing data for scientists and meteorologists have been laid off. Airlines, farmers, and fishermen are among those who rely on NOAA data; NOAA issues crucial warnings to the American public for hurricanes' tornados, floods, and other important weather events.

Trump adminstration is stripping away funding for reearch the the U.S. and overseas that contains the word "climate." In addition, the government websites that have been scrubbed clean of any mention of climate change and global heating. Continued and even increased reliance on non-renewable fuels in the U.S. will set the world behind in the effort to stop climate change

Trump administration tells universities they have two weeks to eliminate diversity initiatives or risk losing federal funding. While the memo from the administration states this move is to eliminate discrimination against White and Asian students, it will clearly lead to discrimination that will affect the education of all students in one way or another.

More massive layoffs at federal agencies, this time at the Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), the Food and Drug Administration (FDA), and the National Institutes of Health (NIH). Workers received emails over the weekend informing them they were fired. The loss of institutional knowledge is enormous.

Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) Intelligent Service Offices, known as "disease detectives" have been spared from the massive layoffs. On the other hand, approximately 10% of the CDCs workforce has been laid off.

Executive Order (EO) "Establishing The National Energy Dominance Council"  establishes a council tp make American energy dominant.advising the President on how to produce more energy, including expansion of natural gas pipelines. The President refuses to focus on wind and solar (i.e., renewable) energy projects and instead focuses on oil.

Executive Order (EO) "Establishing The President's Make America Healthy Again Commission" (MAHA) creates the "Make America Healthy Again" Commission. chaired by the Secretary of Health and Human Services (HHS), MAHA's first task is to conduct a "Make our Children Healthy Again Assessment." Given the background of the HHS Secretary, Robert Kennedy, Jr., as a vaccine skeptic the findings of any report should be reviewed with great caution.

Per a Trump Executive Order (EO), the Center for Disease Control and the Food and Drug Administration removed several webpages and datasets and a judge ordered the agencies to restore the webpages and datasets.

The NIH indirect rate for research grants will be capped at 15%, which will likely underfund the U.S.'s research institutions, as the average rate for Research-intensive (R1) institutions averages 50%. This may cause funding issues and could make the U.S. less competitive internationally.

Ban on D.E.I. Language Sweeps Through the Sciences, as websites and papers are delayed or altered. President Trump’s executive order is altering scientific exploration across a broad swath of fields, even beyond government agencies, researchers say.

Trump makes huge cuts to the USAid workforce and immediately suspends almost all USAid grants, causing health experts to warn of the spread of disease, delays in vaccine development and new treatments.
Trump fires the board members and chair of the Kennedy Center and appoints himself as chair.

Executive Order (EO) "Additional Measures to Combat Anti-Semitism" calls report identifying all civil and criminal authorities or actions that might be used to curb or combat anti-Semitism, and inventorying all pending administrative complaints against or involving K-12 and higher education alleging civil-rights violations related to anti-Semitism. The result of this EO could be revocation of foreign students' and staff visas.

Executive Order (EO) "Ending Radical Indoctrination in K-12 Schools" requires that schools recognize only two sexes and requires they use the term "sex" and not "gender"; bans "discriminatory equity ideology"; requires "patriotic education"; requires a report on ending radical indoctrination. Among many other implications, this EO will limit classroom discussions on race, gender, identity, history, and social issues.

Executive Order (EO) "Protecting Children from Chemical and Surgical Mutilation" orders federal agencies to rescind or amend all policies relying on guidance from the World Professional Association for Transgender Health (WPATH); publish a review of literature on best practices for promoting health for children who have "identity-based confusion"; ensure that all institutions receiving federal funds end gender-affirming health care. This EO restricts access to gender-affirming health care and promotes criminalization of parents and health care providers involved in accessing this care.

Offfice of Management and Budget (OMB) memo temporarily freezes all activities related to obligation or disbursement of all Federal financial assistance, and other relevant agency activities that may be implicated by the Executive Orders (EOs), related to financial assistance for foreign aid, nongovernmental organizations, DEI, woke gender ideology, and the green new deal. Freezing these funds caused many employers with federal grants to layoff employees.

State Department issued a stop work order for all existing foreign aid government grants and contracts. The stop work order includes pausing all funding for the U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR), which provides lifesaving antiretrovirals for 20 million people with HIV.

Executive Order (EO) Enforcing the Hyde Amendment revoked two of Biden's EOs (14076 and 14079), which aimed to provide safety at clinics and pharmacies. Trump's EO limits access to abortion in the U.S. and globally by restricting funds for international organizations that offer access to or promote abortion.

Executive Order (EO) Council to Assess the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) orders a review of FEMA. Co-chairs of the FEMA Council, Secretaries of Homeland Security and Defense, will advise President on FEMA capability, impartiality, and recommend changes to FEMA. Trump wrote this EO, declaring, "...we recommend that FEMA go away."

EO (Executive Order) withdraws the U.S. from the 2016 Paris Agreement climate accord, a legally binding international treaty to combat climate change.

EO (Executive Order) withdraws the U.S. from the WHO (World Health Organization), stopping funding and reassigning personnel. The WHO was established in 1948, following the 1945 formation of the UN (United Nations), to coordinate global responses to epidemics and improvements to mortality rates.
EO (Executive Order) repeals array of Biden-issued orders, including aims to reunite migrant families, protect racial/gender equity and LGBTQ+ rights, block oil and gas leases, and many others
EO (Executive Order) unwinds the Inflation Reduction Act signed into law by Biden, crippling a major piece of climate legislation which reduced fossil-fuel use

EO (Executive Order) expedites energy projects in Alaska, permitting the rollback of environmental protections in place since the establishment of the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge in the 1960s and passage of the Clean AIr, Clean Water, and Endangered Species Acts in the 1970s
EO (Executive Order) declaring a national energy emergency will bypass the Clean Water and Endangered Species Acts, in place from the 1970s, for military construction and energy production
